intro: Barrosoa atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic barrosoa, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of western Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom during the dry season. It thrives in sandy soils and is adapted to saline environments along the coast. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
